items.title: Men arrested in tactical police swoop may have been heading to Bondi
items.description: Investigators believe a group of men arrested by heavily armed police in Sydney's south-west yesterday have "extremist Islamic ideology" and may have been en route to Bondi.

items.title: Live: Thousands at Bondi Beach for memorial service
items.description: Thousands of people gather at Bondi Beach to paddle out into the water to hold a minute's silence for the victims killed on Sunday.

items.title: ASIO's 'grim reality' as it picks over Bondi intelligence gaps
items.description: As Australia's intelligence agencies look back over how the Bondi attackers were missed, a "grim reality" of their jobs confronts the country.

items.title: Former police sergeant claims he warned of Bondi attack a decade ago
items.description: Steve Buttel says he told his bosses "it was only a matter of time" before there would be a terror attack on Bondi's Jewish community.

items.title: How the world reacted to the Bondi massacre
items.description: The shock waves from Sunday's deadly terror attack at Bondi Beach have reverberated around the world from the Middle East to Moscow and Manila.

items.title: More photos released on eve of Epstein files deadline
items.description: US Democrats continue their drip-feed of material from sex predator Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, releasing more photos on the eve of a deadline for the full publication of the Epstein files.

items.title: Practice conditions put on neurosurgeon after behaviour complaints
items.description: Doctor Greg Malham, who was terminated from a Melbourne private hospital following an ABC investigation into his behaviour, will have to undertake mentoring sessions to continue practising.

items.title: Dream life in Australia sold by influencers doesn't match reality
items.description: Influencers push a false promise of easy money and a better life in Australia with a Work and Holiday Visa, inspiring young Indonesians to take extreme measures to chase an almost unrealisable dream.

items.title: Live: Stokes creeps past 50 as England battles on in Adelaide
items.description: England captain Ben Stokes notches the slowest half century of his Test match career as Australia hunts a big first-innings lead on day three in Adelaide. Follow live.

items.title: 'If I was dying, I'd be dead': Calls for better backups as 000 calls fail
items.description: Midwest WA residents could not reach Triple Zero amid a perfect storm of severe weather and fires, causing extended mobile and power outages.

items.title: Breaking: Queensland pause on puberty blockers for trans adolescents to continue
items.description: The Queensland government says it made the decision after considering a 530-page independent review into the evidence surrounding the treatments.

items.title: Family cuts weekly mortgage payment to $330 with rural move
items.description: The Ballini family made the move to regional Queensland where they are are paying half the mortgage they were in the south-east, but that's rapidly changing.

items.title: Prince William and Princess Catherine release 2025 Christmas card
items.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new family portrait to coincide with their annual Christmas card.

items.title: 'Better than anything Russia has got': Australian tanks arrive in Ukraine
items.description: The ABC is granted exclusive access to the ADF operation to transport M1A1 Abrams tanks to Ukraine, via Poland, which included an ocean voyage of more than 50 days.

items.title: TikTok to sell US unit to American investors, including Oracle
items.description: The deal with Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX ensures the social video platform can continue operating in the US.

items.title: Breaking: Victorian premier's husband caught drink driving
items.description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has apologised after her husband was caught drink driving.

items.title: 'Gladiator goes to sea': Russell Crowe on Master and Commander
items.description: Master and Commander flopped in 2003 but is now hailed as a masterpiece. Discover why this epic is earning renewed respect.

items.title: Life on a remote cattle station where 'people leave a little bit better'
items.description: The idea of life out on the edge of the desert has pulled in young people from across the country and overseas.

items.title: Live: Macquarie to pay $35m penalty for misreporting short sales
items.description: A rally on Wall Street sends Australian stocks higher, as a soft inflation report feeds expectations for interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

items.title: Everything you need to know about the Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua fight
items.description: Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua is not the first sham fight, neither will it be the last. But there is a real risk that, one way or another, it will have a lasting impact. Here's everything you need to know about the contest.

items.title: Four youths still at large after staff stabbed in detention centre breakout
items.description: Police say three of the seven youths who escaped the Ashley Youth Detention Centre last night are now back in custody.

items.title: 'We've changed our theory': What recent discoveries say about Celine's last location
items.description: More than two years after Belgian backpacker Celine Cremer vanished near Philosopher Falls, new discoveries have helped investigators better understand her final movements — though many questions still remain.

items.title: This robot is designed to do your chores, but would you trust it?
items.description: Humanoid robots may be part of our future, but human psychology and the uncanny valley may stand between them and world domination.

items.title: Queensland police investigating Nazi symbol graffitied on mosque
items.description: Offensive words were also written on the Brisbane mosque, along with the swastika. WARNING: The following story contains an image of a Nazi symbol.

items.title: Home owners could claim millions if class action against builder succeeds
items.description: Almost two years after the slab went down, Jo and David Dimov's "forever home" is still unfinished. The couple is part of a class action that has "snowballed" against a major WA builder.
